column4: ok guys, so if I want to get cgi and perl running on my system what packages do I need? is there a guide out there?
Everything installed by default
On a server, install "perl" package, that should be it.
Why would you need php5-cgi for perl/cgi? I got perl/cgi running on my system with just apache2 and perl.
Again, why? You don't need PHP to make perl and CGI work.
Do you have apache and perl installed?
You need to put "+ExecCGI" in the Options clause of the Apache config, for all directories where you have CGI scripts
You need to have all CGI scripts executable (chmod +x)
And you should add something like "AddHandler cgi-script .cgi .pl" to the directory in the config
You need to set +x on that permissions that the server will use to access the file.
So if the file is owned by www-data, you should do chmod u+x... if it's in the www-data group, do chmod g+x... if it's neither, do chmod o+x...
The easiest way is to "sudo -R o+x", but it's risky security-wise.
Mh... or maybe "sudo -R +x *"
In that case the permissions are not correct...
You also have to check if the directory is accessible.
In that case, what are the permissions on the file you are testing?
I checked it on my install... either ExecCGI is not correctly set or your permissions. Are you sure ExecCGI is on in that directory/virtualserver/process?
Okay, and the server is restarted since the config chance?
In that case I'm out of ideas... it should work.
Do you have an .htaccess file in that directory?
Okay, out of ideas then. :)
